title: eva_pod
body:
A fictional [[spacecraft]] from the [[2001 A Space Odyssey]] classic [[science fiction]] film from 1968.

The [b]ExtraVehicular Activity Pod[/b] (abbreviated [b]EVA Pod[/b]) is a type of one-man small [[space]] vehicle that served as transporter and mobile workshop during extravehicular activities by the [[Discovery One]] crew.

In [[real life]] the design of the [[Ball (Gundam)]] was inspired by this vehicle.

title: compilation
body: A compilation is a collection of different elements brought together in one place. In the context of media such as movies, songs, or videos, a compilation is a set of hand-picked clips, songs, or scenes presented in a new order or format. It's like a visual or musical scrapbook, where different pieces are combined to create a new experience.

title: pillarboxed
body:
Reverse of [[letterboxed]]. An image resizing technique where vertical bars are displayed on both sides of a picture.
Pillarboxed does not count as a border but [[outside border]] may be used with it.

h4. Examples

* !post #8018111: Black pillarboxed
* !post #8027555: White pillarboxed
* !post #8029128: Colored pillarboxed
* !post #7966336: Landscape pillarboxed

h4.See also

* [[letterboxed]]
* [[border]]
* [[Tag Group:Image Composition]]

title: letterboxed
body:
An image technique where bars are displayed at the bottom and top of a picture.
Letterboxed does not count as a border but [[outside border]] may be used with it.

See [[pillarboxed]] for when an image has bars on the left and right sides.

h4. Examples

* !post #8054586: Common black letterboxed
* !post #8055588: White letterboxed
* !post #8065589: Colored letterboxed
* !post #504: Portrait letterboxed


h4. See also

* [[Tag Group:Image Composition]]
* [[Tag Groups]]
* [[border]]

title: wire_binding
body: A popular commercial book binding method, and is known by various names, including double loop wire, double-o, ring wire, twin loop wire, wire comb, wire-o, wirebind and wiro. With this binding method, users insert their punched pages onto a C-shaped spine, and then use a wire closer to squeeze the spine until it is round. ("Wikipedia":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wire_binding)

title: waffen-ss
body:
The combat branch of the [[Nazi]] Party's paramilitary [i]Schutzstaffel[/i] (SS) organization. [[Heinrich Luitpold Himmler|Heinrich Himmler]], [[Josef Mengele]] and [[Michael Wittmann]] were some of the prominent members.

Generally recognized by the all black [[uniform]] worn by the officers, despite most units did not wear the iconic black SS uniform outside of Germany. Instead they and the [[soldier]]s wore the similar field grey [[military uniform]] of the [[Wehrmacht]]. Pay attention to the specific [[SS insignia|insignia]].

[b]Do not use[/b] for fictional uniforms or outfits modelled after the SS uniform.

h4. See Also
* [[Black Sun (symbol)|]]
* [[Siegrunen]]
* [[Totenkopf]]
* [[Wolfsangel]]
* [[List of Armed Forces]]

title: cigarette_pack
body:
A typically small container of [[cigarette]]s in which they're sold.  They can either be a resealable hard pack, which is a paperboard [[box]], or a non-resealable soft pack, a light paper wrapping.  Governments typically regulate the minimum number of cigarettes per pack, commonly with a minimum of at least 20.

A carton of cigarettes is a box or container that contains usually 10 packs of cigarettes.

* !post #8079563

title: elicia_(luminous_arc_2)
body:
The main villain of [[Luminous Arc 2]].

A Mage Queen who saved countless of lives in the ancient Navilian era. However, as a result of dabbling in forbidden magic as a means to do so, Elicia ended up causing an accident where her magical powers went out of control. She went berserk, and obtained the ability to spawn Beast Fiends, monsters who only crave for destruction and bloodshed. As a result, the ancients sealed Elicia away in the Conclusion Gate.

She is voiced by [[Fujimura Ayumi]] in the Japanese version, and  [[Kira Buckland]] in the localization.
other_names: エリシア(ルミナスアーク2)

title: dulcinea_del_toboso
body:
A fictional female character from the classic [[spain|Spanish]] novel [[Don Quixote (novel)|]].

[b]Dulcinea del Toboso[/b] is an imaginary noble young woman who is unseen in the novel. [[alonso quixano|Don Quijote]] believes he must have a lady, under the mistaken view that [[knight|chivalry]] requires it. As he does not have one, he invents her, making her the very model of female perfection.

Dulcinea's name is based on the [[spanish text|Spanish]] word "dulce" (sweet), and suggests an overly elegant "sweetness". To this day, a reference to someone as one's "Dulcinea" implies idealistic devotion and love for that "sweet" (or "the sweetest") woman.

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Dulcinea del Toboso":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dulcinea_del_Toboso

title: jetix
body:
A [[Disney]]-owned programming brand, hosting a library of action-oriented shows, as well as anime.

The name was used from 2004 to 2010, serving as a programming block on Toon Disney in the US, and as a replacement for Fox Kids internationally, until both Toon Disney and the internationally Jetix channels were renamed into Disney XD.

title: five_star_stories
body:
[b]The Five Star Stories[/b] (ファイブスター物語, Faibu Sutā Monogatari?) is a space opera and [[mecha]] manga series created by [[Nagano Mamoru]], building on his work on the anime series [[Juusenki L-Gaim]]. 

The first volume of the manga was published in April 10, 1986 and is still ongoing.

The story is staged at an alien cluster of four major planetary systems. The God of Light, [[Amaterasu (five star stories)|]], the immortal emperor of the Grees Kingdom on the planet Delta Belune, is destined to rule the whole Joker System. He and [[Lachesis (five star stories)|]], his bride and fatima, are the main characters of this epic [[science fiction]] story.

An anime film adaptation of the first volume, directed by Yamazaki Kazuo, was released in 1989.

h4. See also:

* [[Gothicmade]]
* [[Gothicmade (mecha)]]
* [[Hana no Utame Gothicmade]]

title: don_quixote_(novel)
body:
[quote][i]“Somewhere in la Mancha, in a place whose name I do not care to remember, a gentleman lived not long ago, one of those who has a [[lance]] and ancient [[shield]] on a shelf and keeps a skinny nag and a greyhound for racing.”[/i] ― [b]Miguel de Cervantes[/b], the first lines of [i]Don Quixote[/i].[/quote]

[b]El Ingenioso Hidalgo, Don Quixote de la Mancha[/b], also known as [b]Don Quijote[/b] in [[english text|English]] speaking countries, is a very long (4 volumes), legendary epic [[medieval]] [[fantasy]] "satire":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Satire novel written in 1605 by [[spain|Spanish]] writer "Miguel de Cervantes Saavedra":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Miguel_de_Cervantes.

It is considered the all-time most influential and important literary work of the whole [[spanish text|Spanish]] language. It is also considered a founding work of Western civilization literature, it is often labelled as the first modern novel and one of the greatest works ever written. Don Quixote is also one of the most-translated books in the world and one of the best-selling novels of all time.

The plot revolves around the adventures of an hidalgo (lowest rank of nobility) from La Mancha named [[Alonso Quixano]], who reads so many chivalric romance novels that he [[crazy|loses his mind]] and decides to become a [[knight]]-errant ([i]caballero andante[/i]) to revive chivalry and serve his nation and his kingdom.

The novel has been adapted into several theatrical and musical plays, TV series, motion picture films and even anime over the years.

h4. Characters
* [[Alonso Quixano]]
* [[Sancho Panza]]
* [[Dulcinea del Toboso]]
* [[Rocinante]]

h4. See also
* [[Zukkoke Knight Don de la Mancha]]
* [[Man of la Mancha]]

h4.External links
* "Wikipedia: Don Quixote":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Don_Quixote

title: 2001_a_space_odyssey
body:
[b]2001: A Space Odyssey[/b] is a 1968 British-American [[science fiction]] film produced and directed by [[Stanley Kubrick]]. The screenplay was co-written by Kubrick and [[Arthur C. Clarke]], and was partially inspired by Clarke's short story [i]"The Sentinel"[/i] (1948). Clarke concurrently wrote the novel [i]2001: A Space Odyssey[/i] during production, which was published soon after the film was released (but contains some differences from the movie's plot). 

The film is frequently described as an "epic film", both for its length and scope, and for its affinity with classical epics. It is notable for its scientific accuracy, pioneering special effects, ambiguous imagery that is open-ended, sound in place of traditional narrative techniques, and minimal use of dialogue.

Despite initially receiving mixed reactions from critics and audiences alike, 2001: A Space Odyssey garnered a cult following and slowly became a box office hit. Some years after its initial release, it eventually became the highest grossing picture from 1968 in North America. Today it is near-universally recognized by critics, filmmakers, and audiences as one of the greatest and most influential films ever made. 

In 1984, a sequel directed by Peter Hyams was produced, titled [[2010 (book)|2010: The Year We Make Contact]].

h4. See also

* [[Discovery One]]
** [[HAL 9000]]
** [[Dave Bowman]]
** [[Frank Poole]]
** [[EVA Pod]]

* [[Heywood Floyd]]
* [[Floyd's daughter]]

* [[Monolith (Object)]]

title: penelope_(hathaway's_flash)
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] series. It is an antagonist [[mobile suit]] from [[Gundam Hathaway's Flash]].

The [b]RX-104FF Penelope[/b] is a mode of the RX-104 [[Odysseus Gundam]] (i.e., equipped with the FF [Fixed Flight] Unit). It is classified as a 5th generation MS alongside the [[Xi Gundam|RX-105 Xi Gundam]], which was developed around the same time. It is one of the first mobile suits to be equipped with a miniaturized Minovsky Flight Unit, making it highly capable of sustaining independent atmospheric flight; and was considered to be a MS that would revolutionize the course of MS operations under gravity. While the Xi Gundam had a different structure that integrated all of the functions into a single MS, the Penelope Gundam largely depended on the FF Unit. In addition to the FF unit, it is said that an optional armament known as the Argos Unit was developed, but its details are unknown. It is also said to be equipped with a Psycommu or a Quasi-Psycommu unit. The MS is also capable of supersonic flight by deploying a Beam Barrier in the direction of its movement, but this requires the MS to transform into its Flight Form.

Its armaments consist of a [[beam rifle]], vulcan guns (mounted on the FF Unit's nose), shoulder-mounted Mega Particle [[beam cannon|Cannons]] (which can also be used as handheld [[energy sword|beam sabers]]), forearm-mounted Composite Weapon Units (a unique weapon that houses a Mega Particle Cannon, a Beam Saber, and missiles in a single unit), and its signature [i]Funnel Missiles[/i], which are [[funnels (gundam)|remote-controlled weapons]] guided by the pilot's Newtype abilities and exploding upon impact. These weapons are also equipped on the Xi Gundam.

It is piloted by [[Lane Aim]] of the Circe Special Forces unit, and designed in [[real life]] by [[Moriki Yasuhiro]] for the novel; the design was later updated by Fujita Kazumi for the SD Gundam G-Generation series; this updated design has been used for both video games and figures, with [[Katoki Hajime]] giving the design another update for the Fix Figuration line (where its parts can be swapped with the Xi Gundam).

title: ebi_mome_(meme)
body:
English: Shrimp massage

In 2020, [[Idolmaster Shiny Colors]] released the song "Happy Funny Lucky". The song repeats the chorus "Every moment", which the NicoNico user "Egg":[https://www.nicovideo.jp/user/26886175] thought sounded like "ebi mome" (shrimp massage).

On August 25, 2024 (years later for some reason), Egg uploaded a "video":[https://www.nicovideo.jp/watch/sm44019051] with the song and the [[list_of_idolmaster_shiny_colors_characters|Illumination Stars]] characters each massaging a [[shrimp]]. This video quickly took off as a meme with other users posting parodies with other characters or copyrights.

Coincidentally, about a day later there was a viral "video":[https://twitter.com/LRH_Superfan/status/1827686736480399615] posted of a shrimp being delicately massaged before being beheaded and cut up for [[rice_porridge|congee]].

h4. External links

title: yuki-san
body:
A character made by [[Futaba Channel]]'s Nijiura board, based on [[Kotonomiya Yuki]]. She is usually depiced as identical in appearance to the actual Yuki, but with blue eyes and occassionally slightly ligher hair. She can be identified by her [[empty eyes|empty]]/[[crazy eyes|crazy]] blue eyes, [[:D|wide smile]], and trademark laughter: "Ahahahaha!" (あはははは)

Though she has the same name as the original (who is usually referred to as Yuki-san as well), Yuki-san's name is written as 逝き, with 逝 meaning "die."

title: kiri-san
body:
A character made by [[Futaba Channel]]'s Nijiura board, based on [[Kotonomiya Yuki]].  She can be identified by her long light blue/purple hair, glasses, and brown and white maid uniform.

Kiri-san is [[Yukiko-san]]'s older sister and she worries a lot about her.  She's seemingly older than most of her fellow derivative characters, and is often seen with other middle-aged characters such as [[95]] and [[Daiginjou]].

title: iya_maid
body:
[[Futaba channel]] [[original]] character created by [[NM65]] on Futaba's Rakugaki-Board. She was originally created as a parody of [[Shiya_(nm65)|]], another NM65 maid. Note that she is not a member of [[Nijiura Maids]]. 

She and Shiya are employed by [[Marimo_(nm65)|]], a talking [[marimo|moss ball]]. Iya Maid is always abusing her employer. She has [[green_hair|green]] [[short hair]] with a [[maid headdress]].

title: the_star_child
body:
[spoiler]The space fetus of [[Dave Bowman]], seen at the end of [i]2001: A Space Odyssey[/i].
 In the official book adaptation by Arthur C. Clarke it is described as the next step in human evolution created by the [[monolith_(object)|Monolith]] using Dave Bowman's body. It is made of pure energy and is represented as a fetus (a form Dave Bowman himself decided to adopt) to symbolize a nascent new species. It has advanced almost godlike telekinetic and telepathic powers.[/spoiler]

Her name comes from [i]kiai[/i] - "fighting spirit."

title: kudoi
body:
A [[nijiura maids|Nijiura Maid]] who is incredibly talkative. She is always rambling on and on!

She has orange hair tied up in a loose ponytail with short payot and wears a pink maid uniform.

Her name comes from [i]kudoi[/i] - "verbose."

title: inai
body:
A [[Nijiura Maids|Nijiura Maid]] who is typically invisible. 

Though it's tempting, please do not tag her in every Nijiura Maid image just because she is invisible. Usually, there will be signs of her presence (like a bowl with seemingly no one at it, or just a shadow.)  When she appears, she has long [[black hair]] and wears a (typically green) [[camo]] maid uniform.

Her name comes from [i]inai[/i] - "not here."

title: hidoi
body:
A [[nijiura maids|Nijiura Maid]] who is awful at everything, especially cooking.  Often depicted messing things up, being subjected to cruel treatment, and/or generally having (appropriately) awful luck. 

She has long brown hair tied in low twintails and wears a blue maid uniform. 

Her name comes from [i]hidoi[/i] - "awful."

title: ball_(gundam)
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] [[science fiction]] series. It first appeared in the [[Mobile Suit Gundam]] TV show from 1979.

The [b]RB-79 Ball[/b] is a simplistic mobile weapon created by the [[Earth Federation]] to support their fledgling [[mobile suit]] [[space]] forces. They are usually deployed in vast numbers and operate only in [[zero gravity]] environments. 

Despite its unassuming looks and less than unique armament, the Ball was somewhat agile and possessed multiple different configurations, which made the pokey machines quite dangerous in the right hands. It is said that a Ball, piloted by [[Shiro Amada]], was even capable of defeating a [[Zaku II]] High Mobility Type in one-on-one combat.

In [[real life]] its design was inspired by the [[EVA pod]]s from [[2001 A Space Odyssey]].

body:
[b]Sidonia No Kishi[/b], also known as [b]Knights of Sidonia[/b], is a [[science fiction]] manga created by [[Nihei Tsutomu]] (of [[Blame!]] fame) about an interstellar war between humanity and the [[alien]] [[Gauna]], and [[mecha]] pilot [[Tanikaze Nagate]], caught in the middle of the conflict. 

The manga series began in 2009 and ended in September 2015. In May 2013 "an anime adaptation":http://www.animenewsnetwork.com/news/2013-05-16/tsutomu-nihei-knights-of-sidonia-manga-gets-anime was announced. Its first season lasted 12 episodes and was broadcasted from April 11, 2014 until June 27, 2014 in Japan. A second season was broadcast on the same dates in 2015.

The localized anime series is currently available for streaming exclusively on Netflix in all its territories.

title: maxim_gun
body:
A [[ammunition belt|belt-fed]] medium [b][[machine gun]][/b] invented in 1884 by Hiram Stevens Maxim and is historically the earliest example for an recoil-operated (or fully automatic) [[gun]], opposed to the manually operated [[gatling gun]] which has a hand[[crank]] for the user. It entered various armed conflicts since 1886, most notably the Two World Wars even until 21st century's [[Russo-Ukrainian war]]. Its tubular [[barrel shroud]] stores water for cooling the barrel.

The Maxim gun is usually mounted on wheeled carriages, vehicles, or [[tripod]]s, and sometimes equipped with a shield. A single personnel can fire the [[weapon]] , but a crew was required to carry spare ammunition, water, and a target spotter.

This tag also applies to its Russian/Soviet counterpart chambered in 7.62×54mmR, the PM M1910. Do not use the tag on any machine gun with a water-cooling jacket on its barrel like the [[Schwarzlose machine gun]] and [[Browning M1917]], and further research if the gun is a variant of the Maxim before tagging.

h4. Variants

* [[MG08]]
* [[Vickers machine gun]]
* PM M1910

h4. See also

* [[List of Weapons]]
* [[PM1910 (Girls' Frontline)]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Maxim gun":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Maxim_gun

title: winds_of_thunder
body:
[b]Winds of Thunder[/b] (released as [b]Lords of Thunder[/b] outside [[Japan]]) is a horizontally scrolling medieval [[fantasy]] and [[science fiction]] [[mecha]] 2D shooter [[video game]] developed by Red Company and published in 1993 by Turbo Technologies and [[Hudson]] Soft for the TurboDuo. 

In the game the player controls the heroic [[knight]] [[landis_(winds_of_thunder)|Landis]], donning the magical [[power armor]] of his ancestor Drak on a confrontation against [[Zaggart]] of the brutal Garuda Empire, who resurrected the evil god Deoric, and his six dark generals across the land of Mistral.

First released on the [[pc_engine_duo|TurboDuo]], the title was ported to the [[Sega CD]] by Hudson Soft and Eleven in 1995, and has since been re-released through the Virtual Console and [[PlayStation]] Network download services, in addition of being included on the [[PC Engine]] Mini console.

Critics praised its stylish and sharp visuals for showcasing the capabilities of the TurboGrafx, large and detailed bosses, ability to choose between stages, lack of slowdown and flickering, frantic pacing and hard rock soundtrack, though the gameplay and difficulty were met with mixed response. The Sega CD port received mixed reception from reviewers for being inferior due to the washed out colors, audio balancing issues, low difficulty compared to the original version, instances of sprite flickering and lack of fine-tuning. Retrospective commentary have been positive and is considered one of the most important shooting games on the PC Engine.

title: gaiwan
body:
Chinese [[tea]] brewing vessel that can be used in place of a [[teapot]] or simply as a [[cup|drinking cup]].

Gaiwan consists of a bowl, a [[lid]], and a [[saucer]]. They are typically small enough that all three parts can be picked up in one hand. 

Developed during the Ming Dynasty, it is considered the preferred method for brewing teas with delicate flavors.

A similar Japanese equivalent is the [[chawan]], which is different in shape, and less often depicted with a lid.

h4. See Also

* [[Tag Group:Food tags]]

title: chawan
body:
A [[bowl]] used for [[tea]] preparation and [[drinking]] in East Asia.

Tea preparation can sometimes be seen with a [[chasen]] (whisk).

The Chinese close equivalent, usually seen with a lid, is the [[gaiwan]].

* The word's literal translation is "tea bowl".

title: green_tea
body:
A variety of [[tea]], and as such, it is sometimes depicted in a [[yunomi]], which is a Japanese teacup without handles. 

For the powder used to make green tea, see [[matcha_(food)|]].

h4. Trivia
Green tea doesn't pass a fermentation/oxidation stage after drying. The color of its leaves are dark green, and will result in a very lightly-coloured brew when steeped.

title: shikishi
body:
Shikishi 色紙 (しきし) is a particular format of paperboard for art, [[calligraphy]], [[poem|poetry]] and [[signature|autographs]]. Recognizable by its squarish dimensions, it also has characteristic edges which are often evident in posts that are [[photo (medium)|]]s of [[traditional media]] pieces.

As it is popularly used by artists drawing sketches to give away at conventions (e.g. pool #1135), the term is sometimes used to describe such drawings as well. These are often autographed, dated and/or inscribed with the name of the convention (and artist's booth number). [[marker_(medium)|Marker]] is a common medium for these.

[i]Sanseido Daijirin[/i] gives two dimensions for shikishi: 19.4×17 cm and 18.2×16 cm. Some pixiv taggers will use 「小色紙」 ("small shikishi") for the smaller size. Variants may be colored, have pre-printed elements, or may even have gold or silver leaf embedded in the paper. Fancy [[novelty_shikishi|novelty]] types are sometimes used; these may come in a different shape (post #1952713) or expose a differently shaped drawing area instead of the full card (e.g. post #523719). 

Not to be confused with irogami 色紙 (いろがみ), colored paper commonly used for crafts and origami.

For some 'shikishi' present in drawn images, use [[shikishi (object)]].

title: internet_yamero_(meme)
body:
Japanese internet [[meme]] encouraging people to take a break from the Internet. The fans and creators of Japanese online music label Maltine Records began using the phrase, and began providing stickers featuring it over images of [[Hannah Steller|Parked Domain Girl]]. Several songs inspired by this meme would be made, famously [[Internet Yamero]] (and [[Internet Survivor]]).

Use this tag for posts which reference the Internet Yamero stickers. For the dances and visuals from the song and MV of the same name, see [[Internet Yamero]].

title: mine_(spacezin)
body:
[[Personification]] of [[Electrode (pokemon)]] (Marumine in Japan) by [[Spacezin]].
She has an younger [[sisters|sister]] named [[Biriri (Spacezin)|]].

h5. JP description
h6. Latest https://omochi6262.blog.fc2.com/blog-entry-34.html#mine
名前：マイン
性別：♀
[[Character age|年齢]]：26歳
[[Height|身長]]：[[tall female|181cm]]
[[Weight|体重]]：78kg
[[Three sizes|BWH]]：[[huge breasts|108]]-65-98(cm)
一人称：私

「爆弾は解体だけじゃなく、作るのも得意なのさ♪」
「ビリリちゃ～ん！お姉ちゃんの顔、忘れてないよね？」
「テメェのキンタマ両方とも蹴り潰してやる！！」

ビリリ姐さんの実姉。特殊部隊の爆発物処理班員。
姉妹らしく髪色は赤。目元が前髪で隠れているが、ビリリ姐さんを上回る凄みのある目付き。
一見するとさほど恐い雰囲気はなさそうだが、実際は全くの逆。
怒りが爆発した時の激昂加減は姐さんの比ではなく、
ビリリ姐さんの爆発が技の「じばく」に相当するとすれば、彼女のは「だいばくはつ」。

格闘技能も優れていて、戦闘能力は高い。電撃はビリリ姐さんと同じく放電のみ。
特に動体視力と瞬発力は桁違いで、攻撃を見てから避けることも朝飯前。
そして彼女も金蹴りが得意…というより、タマを蹴り上げるのが好きな節がある。
特にタマが破裂する瞬間の感触や、潰され敗北した男を見下すのを楽しんでいる。
（ただし、好き放題にタマを潰す狂人でもない。機会があれば積極的に実行しているだけ）

このように、キレやすい性格、非常識な思考回路、男性蔑視的な感覚がある姉のことを
ビリリ姐さんは苦手に思っていて、物心ついた時からあまり関わりたがらなかった。
反対に彼女は妹のことを思って、大事にしてあげているつもりでいる。

この髪型も幼少の頃、生まれつき目付きが恐い彼女の顔を見て、
まだ赤ん坊のビリリ姐さんが泣き出してしまい、それから目元を隠すようになったという。
学生時代でも、妹を傷つける奴には容赦なく報復する過保護っぷりで、
自分が怪我しようがお構いなしに大喧嘩することで恐れられた。

これらの経緯から、ビリリ姐さんの自立心が早くに芽生える要因となった。
同時に、金的などを得意とする一方で、男性蔑視や嗜虐的意識を持たないのは、
姉である彼女を反面教師とした結果であることは、言うまでもない。

title: supermarine_spitfire
body:
[[World War II]] [[airplane]] famous for its role in the defense of the United Kingdom during the Battle of Britain. The elliptical-winged Spitfire and its carrier variant the [[Supermarine seafire]] served from the late 1930s all the way to the 1950s, with the last model (the clipped-wing, bubble-canopied Mark 24) being used in the Malayan Emergency.

Some Spitfires carried eight .303in [[browning m1919|Browning]] [[machine gun]]s as armament, while other models were also armed with 20mm cannon, the barrels of which protruded from the leading edge of the wings. A few Spitfires were equipped with two [[browning m2|.50 caliber]] machine guns in lieu of .303s. Other ordnance carried included light bombs or rockets. 

h4. See also

* [[List of airplanes]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Supermarine Spitfire":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Supermarine_Spitfire

title: tirpitz_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the German battleship [i]Tirpitz[/i]. Character design by [[Hao (patinnko)|]], voiced by [[Tanaka Atsuko]]. 

She is portrayed with [[short hair|short]] [[white hair]], [[blue eyes]], and [[large breasts]].

Her default outfit is a white [[military uniform]], [[white headwear|white]] [[peaked cap]], [[white gloves]], [[cross earrings]], [[black skirt|black]] [[pencil skirt]] with a [[German flag print]] on her left side, and [[white footwear| white]] [[fur trim]] [[thigh boots]]. She is also shown holding a red Nordic cross [[flag]], a reference to her historical stint as a one-ship "fleet in being" in Norway.

Her [[rigging]] consists of four interconnected hull pieces, each with a 380 mm twin gun mount and held by her bridge structure to her back. Two 533 mm quad [[torpedo tubes]] are also mounted.

body:

title: zhiyu_moke
body:
Zhiyu Moke (徵羽摩柯) is a part of the [[vsinger (vocaloid)|Vocaloid China]] project. He's described as a boy genius with an IQ of 168, but is also an [[Otaku]], by which only his closest friends know of this. He is often mistaken for a girl and has a dislike towards this. However, it is rumored that he [[crossdressing|crossplays]].

He is formerly known as [b]MOKO[/b], an [[original]] [[Vocaloid]] character illustrated by SAKU. His design was a top rank choice during the "Vocaloid China Project".

His voicebank was released on July 16, 2018.

title: ninomiya_asuka
body:
An [[iDOLMASTER Cinderella Girls|iDOLM@STER Cinderella Girls]] character in the Cool category.

She enjoys hair dyeing and buckle fashion. Asuka is intense and brooding, and trying to find her identity like many other 14-year-olds. She can be summed up as a [[chuunibyou]], but unlike [[Kanzaki Ranko|Ranko]] (who she is often associated with by fans), Asuka is decidedly more of the cool or subcultural type. Asuka is very self-aware, and asks the Producer to cut her some slack if she's unpleasant at times because she's dealing with puberty. While she is initially an enemy to the Cinderella Girls cast, she later joins them and is available to produce.

In the tie in Cinderella Girls Theater skits, Asuka is introduced by [[Makihara Shiho]]. She believes love and peace to be the same in principle, as only those who believe in them have them. Her views of mystical or paranormal objects are that she doesn’t think that they can exist outside of a person’s imagination. She does not like black coffee and thinks that the aura of the office roof is heartwarming.

Due to her popularity, she was selected for the 9th set of CINDERELLA MASTER CD series, alongside [[Igarashi Kyoko]], [[Ohtsuki Yui]], [[Nakano Yuka]], and [[Aiba Yumi]]. She is voiced by [[Aoki Shiki]] [青木 志貴].

title: compile
body:
Compile Co., Ltd. (株式会社コンパイル, [i]Kabushikigaisha Konpairu[/i]) was a Japanese [[video game]] developer created in 1982, most notable for having developed the [[PuyoPuyo]] series, a franchise derived from the [[Madou Monogatari]] series. It also created several popular shoot'em up series of games for the [[arcade]] and [[game_console|home consoles]] during the [[1980s_(style)|80s]] and [[1990s_(style)|90s]].

On 6 November 2003, the company suffered from bankruptcy. As a result, key staff moved to [[Compile Heart]], the company's spiritual successor, whereas shoot-'em-up staff moved to MileStone Inc.

h4.Some Compile titles and series

* [[Aleste]]
** [[MUSHA Aleste]]
** [[GG Aleste]]

** [[Senjin Aleste]]

title: otomune_kozue_(gyaru)_(erako9)
body:
An [[alternate costume|unofficial alternate design]] of [[Otomune Kozue]] depicted as a [[gyaru]] created by [[Erako9]]. 

Unlike her usual self, this version of Kozue is an outright [[kogal]], with all the mannerisms and fashion sense that follows.

She wears a generic [[school uniform]] consisting of a [[short sleeves|short-sleeved]] [[white shirt]] [[partially unbuttoned|unbuttoned enough]] to show [[cleavage]] and a [[green cardigan|green]] [[cardigan around waist|cardigan around her waist]]. Her hair is styled in a [[big hair|much bigger]] [[side ponytail]], [[single side bun]] and [[curly sidelocks]], and adorned with [[x hair ornament]]s, a [[rabbit hair ornament|rabbit]] [[hairclip]], and [[too many bows|too many]] [[hair bow]]s.

Her [[casual]] outfit consists of a [[brown sweater|brown]] [[off-shoulder sweater]], [[black pants|black]] [[pants]] and [[sunglasses]].

title: duel_disk
body:
A device used for playing [i][[Duel Monster]][/i] card games in the  [[Yu-Gi-Oh!]] manga and anime. Typically takes the shape of a forearm-mounted contraption with foldable blades that is used to place cards on it. The device utilizes "Solid Vision" technology to generate [[hologram]] of monsters and cards played by both players.

In [[real life]], the device was conceived by [[Takahashi Kazuki]] as a way to give characters an ability move to more freely during a card game match for dramatic effect instead of having them [[duel (yu-gi-oh!)|duelling]] on a table.

title: kusuriya_no_hitorigoto
body:
Kusuriya no Hitorigoto (English title: The Apothecary Diaries) is a series of light novels by Hyuuga Natsu. It originally started as a web novel in 2011, but its first volume was picked up by Ray Books in 2012 and subsequently published by Hero Bunkoban. There are two manga adaptations; the former (Kusuriya no Hitorigoto) by [[Nekokurage_(Gen'eikai_Tsuushin)|Nekokurage]] in Big Gangan, and latter (Kusuriya no Hitorigoto: Maomao no Koukyuu Nazotoki Techou) by [[Kurata Minoji]] in Sunday Gene-X. A Historical Fantasy, it is set in a Chinese inspired land.

h4. Characters

h6. Main

* !asset #19757388: [[Maomao_(kusuriya_no_hitorigoto)|]] (Protagonist)
* !asset #19757497: [[Jinshi_(kusuriya_no_hitorigoto)|]]

title: playstation_portable_go
body:
The Playstation Portable Go (PSP Go) was a late version of the [[Playstation Portable]] [[handheld game console]] released in 2009.  Unlike other iterations of the PSP, the PSP Go featured a sliding design similar to slider cellphones/smartphones with the controls hidden when not slid open. The PSP Go also lacked UMD disc support, requiring all games to be digital downloads purchased through the Playstation Store.

h4. Examples

* !post #995255

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: PSP Go (N1000)":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/PlayStation_Portable#PSP_Go_(N1000)]

title: playstation_portable
body:
The [b]PlayStation Portable[/b] (officially abbreviated PSP) is a [[handheld game console]] manufactured and marketed by [[Sony]]. 

The system was released in Japan on December 12, 2004, in North America on March 24, 2005 and in Europe and Australia on September 1, 2005.

The PlayStation Portable is the only handheld video game console to use an optical disc format, Universal Media Disc (UMD), as its primary storage medium. Other distinguishing features of the console include its large viewing screen, robust multi-media capabilities, and connectivity with the [[PlayStation 2]], [[PlayStation 3]], other PSPs and the Internet.

The XrossMediaBar (pronounced cross-media bar and officially abbreviated as XMB) is a graphical user interface developed by Sony Computer Entertainment that was first used in this handled system. 

A slimmer, lighter, remodeled version of the PlayStation Portable (the PSP-2000/"Slim & Lite") was released in early September 2007. 

This model was later replaced by another remodeling, the PSP-3000, which included a new screen and an inbuilt microphone. Since then, a complete redesign called the [[Playstation Portable Go|PSP Go]] has been released, which was sold alongside the PSP-3000. 

In 2011 a budget model, the PSP-E1000, was released. The PSP line was succeeded by the [[PlayStation Vita]] released in 2012.

title: popoi_(puyopuyo)
body:
A [[black cat]] from [[Puyopuyo]]. He is owned by [[Accord sensei|Accord]]. 

He debuted in [[Puyopuyo Fever]], where he takes on a shadowy, monstrous form called [[Black Popoi]], but he reverts back into a regular-sized cat by the end. After this game, he typically assumes the form of a normal cat; his shadowy form can only be seen again in [[Puyopuyo Quest]]. 

* !asset #22973374: Fever
* !asset #22973381: [[puyopuyo 20th anniversary|20th Anniversary]], et al.

h4. Trivia
* He's allegedly a sentient puppet.
* In the original Japanese, he and Accord are both voiced by Kouzuki Miwa. The same goes for the English VA (uncredited). But from [[Puyopuyo Tetris]] onwards, his English voice is by [[Kyle Hebert]].

h4. See also
* [[List of Puyopuyo characters]]

title: fiat_500
body:
A small two-door city [[car]] produced by Italian manufacturer [[Fiat]] from 1957-1975, succeeding the [[Fiat 600]] in blueprints. Powered by a very small engine, its characteristic features include the lack of a radiator air intake in front (the manufacturer logo usually being placed there), wide-set round headlamps with small turn signal lights, and a generally rounded appearance (though not as rounded as the comparable [[Volkswagen Beetle]]). Some models were fitted with a retractable roof.

The car has found its way into various properties over the years, with it being used as the transport vehicle of choice for the main characters of the [[Lupin III]] series, as well as the Disney-Pixar [[Cars (movie)|]] series portraying the vehicle in the character Luigi.

h4. See also

* [[motor vehicle]]

h4. External links

* Wikipedia: "Fiat 500":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fiat_500

title: takuma_sakazaki
body:
A character in the [[Ryuuko no Ken|Art of Fighting]] and [[The King of Fighters]] series.

He is the founder and grandmaster of [[karate|Kyokugen-ryuu Karate]], inventor of the [[Haou Shoukou Ken|Haoh Shoukou Ken]] technique. He is the father of two children - elder son [[Ryou Sakazaki|Ryo]] and younger daughter [[Yuri Sakazaki|Yuri]]. He is a widower, his wife Ronnet having died in a car accident while Ryo and Yuri were young in an act of foul play orchestrated by South Town crime lord [[Geese Howard]].

He has an alter ego named [[Mr. Karate]], who comes out when Takuma wears a [[tengu mask]], a remnant of when he had to hide his identity while working under Geese. Everyone knows it's him, yet he still denies it.

title: marisa_stole_the_precious_thing
body:
A [[Touhou]] fan arrangement and remix song by the doujin music group [[IOSYS]], or the accompanying viral Flash [[music video]].

The song is probably IOSYS's most famous release to date, spawning an official two-volume remix album, alongside countless parodies and references.  The song is also a notable example of a Marisa-Alice pairing in [[Touhou]] fanart.

A version of the "song and MV":[/posts/8031682] would be released by [[McDonald's]] in August 2024, stripped of its Touhou imagery, entitled "McDonald's has Created Something Incredible ~No Way They're Putting Three Thick Beef Patties in the Samurai Mac®" (マクドは大変なものを作っていきました ~サムライマック®に肉厚ビーフ3枚も入れるなし〜), advertising the return of the triple patty version of the Samurai Mac.

h4. See also

* [[Oyome ni Shinasai]]
* [[IOSYS Parody]]

title: thanos
body:
A supervillain appearing in American comic books published by [[marvel|Marvel Comics]]. Created by writer-artist Jim Starlin, the character first appeared in The Invincible [[Iron Man]] #55 (cover date February 1973).

An Eternal–Deviant warlord from the moon Titan, Thanos is regarded as one of the most powerful beings in the Marvel Universe. He has clashed with many heroes including the [[avengers (series)|Avengers]], the [[Guardians of the Galaxy]], the [[Fantastic Four]], and the [[X-Men]].

Traditionally depicted as a power-hungry tyrant who wields the [[Infinity Gauntlet]] as his signature weapon. He was recharacterized in his [[Marvel Cinematic Universe]] incarnation as a tragic villain who wanted to erase half of the universe's population in order to "save" it from its eventual destruction from resource shortage.

In the MCU, the character was first played by Damion Poitier in the film [[The Avengers (2012)]] and then by Josh Brolin in Guardians of the Galaxy (2014), [[Avengers: Age of Ultron]] (2015), [[Avengers: Infinity War]] (2018), [[Avengers: Endgame]] (2019), and the first season of the animated series [[What If...? (disney+)|]] (2021).

title: what_if...?_(disney+)
body: A Disney+ original [[Marvel]] animated series that explores various [[alternate universe]] scenarios based on the [[marvel cinematic universe|MCU]].

title: shun'ei
body: The fourth Hero of [[The King of Fighters]] series, the protagonist of the "New Age Saga" consisting of [[The King of Fighters XIV]] and [[The King of Fighters XV]]. He is a young man adopted and trained under [[Tung Fue Rue|Tung Fu Rue]] to control his chaotic powers, manifested as red and blue spectral hands. [[Meitenkun]] is his training partner and best friend. [[Isla (KOF)|]] is his Rival, and the two of them are central to solving the mystery of Verse, Otoma-Raga, and the multiverse.

title: isla_(kof)
body: The fourth Rival of [[The King of Fighters]], debuting in [[The King of Fighters XV]] as the Rival to Hero [[Shun'ei]]. She is always seen with her partner, two spectral floating hands named [b]Amanda[/b]. She is a [[Chile|Chilean]] orphan with a love of art who, with Amanda's help, escaped her abusive orphanage and survived on the streets. She makes her living posting her street art to social media. When she watches the events of [[The King of Fighters XIV]] and sees Shun'ei, she instantly grows jealous of him for having a close support circle while she doesn't, even though they both have the same powers. She and Shun'ei are central to solving the mystery of Verse, Otoma-Raga, and the multiverse.

title: meitenkun
body: A character from [[The King of Fighters]], debuting in [[The King of Fighters XIV]]. He is a student of [[Tung Fue Rue|Tung Fu Rue]], and the training partner and best friend of [[Shun'ei]]. His primary feature is being perpetually sleepy while also abusrdly powerful. His fighting style is Hakkyokuminminken (Eight Extremes Sleepy Fist), a variant of Hakkyokuseiken that takes advantage of his sleepy nature.

title: tung_fue_rue
body:
[b]Tung Fu Rue[/b] is a character fron SNK's [[Fatal Fury]] series. He is the grandmaster of Hakkyokuseiken (八極聖拳, Eight Extremes Holy Fist), an esoteric martial arts style that emphasizes chi control. His most famous trick involves projection of chi to make him look like a hulking, muscular being. Known students of his include Jeff Bogard, [[Geese Howard]], [[Cheng Sinzan]], [[Terry Bogard]], [[Andy Bogard]], [[Shun'ei]], and [[Meitenkun]].

h4.See also

* [[tanghulu]] - a Chinese candied fruit with the same hanji.

title: ra_(mythology)
body: [b]Ra[/b] is the [[Egyptian mythology|Ancient Egyptian]] god of the Sun and chief deity of the Egyptian pantheon. He is depicted as having a [[falcon]]'s head. [[aten_(mythology)|Aten]], the sun disk god, was originally spun off from Ra.

title: persephone_(mythology)
body:
In [[Greek mythology]], [b]Persephone[/b] is the goddess of springs and wife of [[Hades (mythology)|]], thus making her the queen of the underworld. Well-known for her love story with Hades, primarily due to the lack of debauchery elements that is common among other Greek myths.

In the original myth, Hades kidnapped her into the underworld. Unlike his [[Zeus (mythology)|younger]] [[Poseidon (mythology)|brother]], Hades did not violate Persephone and took a good care of her. When Persephone's mother [[Demeter (mythology)|]] learned of Hades' antics, she pleaded Hades to release her daughter to the surface due to the world being slowly frozen in her absence. Hades agreed, but not before Persephone ate a promaganate due to Hades' trickery, causing her to be bounded with the underworld and thus were able to stay outside for only six months. Creating a seasonal cycle in process.

title: athena_(mythology)
body:
In [[Greek mythology]], [b]Athena[/b] is the goddess of wisdom, handicraft, and warfare. As well as the patron goddess of the city of Athens.

Birth directly from [[Zeus (mythology)|]]'s head. She is often seen as one of the fairer members of the Greek pantheon, having played a direct role in the Illiad and the Odyssey, aiding Achaeans and Odysseus respectively. However, much like the rest of Greek gods, she is not without her own brand of pettiness, as she transformed [[Medusa_(mythology)|]] into a monster with [[snake hair]] as punishment for having [i]been raped[/i] by [[poseidon_(mythology)|Poseidon]] in her temple, and a feud with [[hera_(mythology)|Hera]] and [[Aphrodite (mythology)|]] would plant the seeds for the Trojan War.

title: three_little_pigs
body:
A British fable concerning three [[piglet]]s who build their house of different materials. Then, the [[Big Bad Wolf]] appears and proceed to blow away the first two piglets' house that were made out of straw and wood, respectively. Prompting the two piglets to shelter in the last house to avoid being eaten.

However, the third piglet's house is made out of bricks, and as such the wolf failed to blew it away. Infuriated, the wolf attempts to enter the brick house through a chimney, but ended up being boiled to death by the piglets as a result.

title: big_bad_wolf
body:
An archetypal fairytale character, describing a fictional [[wolf]], generally portrayed as the antagonist in the stories they appear in, whether as an embodiment of evil, a moral corrupter, an predator, etc. Likely inspired by the risk of wolf attacks in centuries past.

The most famous iteration of the Big Bad Wolf comes from [[Little Red Riding Hood]], but big bad wolves aren't unique to it nor Grimm's Fairy Tales in general (ex. the English fable the [[Three Little Pigs]]). Use this tag for generic depictions of fairytale big bad wolves only, tagged with the relevant fairytale tag if they are meant to represent any one in particular, with more distinct iterations of the archetype being given their own tags instead.

h4. External links

* Wikipedia: "Big Bad Wolf":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Big_Bad_Wolf]

title: aesop's_fables
body:
A series of ancient Greek fables as told by Aesop, generally involves teaching moral values though the story of a just or corrupt characters who were rewarded or punished accordingly for their deeds.

Due to its ease of understanding and localization, it is among one of the most culturally influential works, which spawned several derivatives around the world.

h4. Tagged fables
* [[The Tortoise and the Hare]]
* [[The Dog and its reflection]]
* [[Honest Axe]]
* [[The Boy who cried Wolf]]

h4. See also
* "Wikipedia":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aesop's%20Fables]

title: greece
body:
A country in Southeast [[Europe]] strategically located at the crossroads of Europe, Asia, the Middle East, and Africa. It shares land borders with [[Albania]], Northern Macedonia, and [[Bulgaria]] to the north and [[Turkey (country)|]] to the northeast.

Modern [b]Greece[/b] traces its roots to the civilization of Ancient Greece, considered the cradle of Western civilization. As such it is the birthplace of democracy, Western philosophy, the Olympic Games, Western literature and historiography, political science, major scientific and mathematical principles, and Western drama, including both tragedy and comedy. 

The cultural and technological achievements of Greece greatly influenced the world, both East and West. Many aspects of the Greek civilization were imparted to the East thanks to Alexander the Great's campaigns, and to the West since Roman times.

h4.See also

* [[300 (movie)|]]
* [[Aesop's Fables]]

* [[Oracle (Ancient Greece)]]

title: the_tortoise_and_the_hare
body:
The Tortoise and the Hare (also known as The Hare and the Tortoise) is one of the most famous of [[Aesop's Fables]].

The story concerns a [[rabbit|hare]] who ridicules a slow-moving [[tortoise]] and is challenged by him to a race. The hare soon leaves the tortoise behind and, confident of winning, decides to take a nap midway through the course. When he awakes, however, he finds that his competitor, crawling slowly but steadily, has arrived before him.

It was initially owned by Shadi before being taken by [[Yami Bakura]].

title: superman
body:
A popular and iconic superhero from [[DC Comics]], and the main character of the comic series [[superman (series)|of the same name]].

The humanoid [[alien]] from Planet Krypton, sent to Earth as an infant child. His birth name is [b]Kal-El[/b], and his adoptive parents name him [[Clark Kent]]. As living under a yellow sun grants Clark immense powers, such as hypersonic flight, nigh invulnerability, super strength, heat vision, a freezing breath, hypersensitive hearing, X-ray vision, and many others, he takes up the mantle of [b]Superman[/b] - wearing a [[superhero costume]] that consists of a [[red cape]] and a [[blue bodysuit|blue]] [[bodysuit|suit]] - as he performs great heroic deeds around the Earth and in the city of Metropolis.

In many crossover media, Superman is frequently depicted as a rival of [[Batman]], primarily due to their contrasting qualities. Such as Superman's usage of superhuman power compared to Batman's usage of gadgets, and their clashing philosophies regarding how to handle a villain.

Superman was created by the late Joe Shuster and the late Jerry Siegel and was first introduced in [i]Action Comics[/i] #1 (1938)

title: game_controller
body:
A device used to provide input to a computer or [[video game]]. Normally this refers to a controller that is separate from the main machine, connected by wire or wirelessly, as opposed to the controls built into a handheld portable game machine such as [[Game Boy]] or [[Nintendo DS]]. Examples of game controllers may include [[gamepad]], [[joystick]] (which should really not be confused with gamepad), arcade stick, flightstick, steering wheel, lightgun, the Microsoft Kinect for [[Xbox 360]], and many, many more.

See "Wikipedia definition":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Game_controller for more details.

body:
[i]Yume ga Koko Kara Hajimaru yo[/i] (lit. [i]Our Dreams Begin Here[/i]), a team song featuring [[Love Live! Nijigasaki High School Idol Club|Nijigasaki High School Idol Club]].
Considered the girls didn't wear the same costume, instead, they wear their own clothes that appeared in the past solo episodes.

title: love_live!_school_idol_festival_all_stars
body:
A mobile rhythm game by Bushiroad branded as a Rhythm Action RPG, following on the success of [i][[Love Live! School Idol Festival]][/i] and released on September 26, 2019 in Japan and February 24-25, 2020 internationally. The game was announced at Tokyo Game Show 2017 and was especially notable for the actresses who play the leaders of title groups µ's and Aqours ([[Nitta Emi]] and [[Inami Anju]]) sharing a stage for the first time, which foreshadowed the members of µ's and Aqours interacting for the first time as part of the game's storyline.

The main cast includes not only all 18 combined members of µ's and Aqours but also marks the debut of the original nine members of the [[Love Live! Nijigasaki High School Idol Club|Nijigasaki High School Idol Club]], including three members who had previously appeared as Normal-rarity characters in [i]LL: SIF[/i] and won a popularity poll. The nine new members' actresses were also announced at TGS 2017. [[Mifune Shioriko]], [[Zhong Lanzhu]] and [[Mia Taylor]] also initially appeared in this game as rival characters before joining Nijigasaki.

In a break with the anime premise, [i]All Stars[/i] has both µ's, Aqours and Nijigasaki in high school at the same time and includes interactions between members of all three groups as part of the story. Other features include fully rendered dances, skill tree development and features to recognize players who had already been playing [i]LL: SIF[/i] using SIF IDs.

Game service ended on June 30, 2023. It also marks the end of [[Kusunoki Tomori]]'s role as [[Yuki Setsuna]].

Use this tag for game-original characters, references to events or interactions from the game or for costumes exclusive to the game.

title: rina_sawayama
body:

title: you're_finally_awake_(meme)
body:
English: [i]"Hey, you. You're finally awake."[/i]
Japanese: [i]"おい、そこのあんた。やっと目が覚めたか？" ("Hey, you there. Have you finally woken up?")[/i]

The very first piece of dialogue heard in a new game of [[The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim]], spoken by [[Ralof]] to the player as they travel together in a prison cart. Has since become a [[meme]].

h4. See also

* [[Nine years in a coma (meme)|]] - another meme with similar format
* [[Waking up from 2020 (meme)|]]

title: waking_up_from_2020_(meme)
body:
A [[meme]] featuring characters reacting to the viewer as if the viewer suddenly woke up from a coma and discovered that the last few years were all a bad dream.

Not to be confused with [[You're Finally Awake (meme)|]] from [[The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim]].

h4. External links

* "Know Your Meme: You're Finally Awake / You Hit Your Head Really Hard ":[https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/youre-finally-awake-you-hit-your-head-really-hard]

title: nine_years_in_a_coma_(meme)
body:
Parody of a scene from the prologue of [[Metal Gear Solid V: The Phantom Pain]].

The scene revolves a first person view of [[Venom Snake]] when he is told by the doctor that he has recently recovered from a 9-year coma and the situation during his absence is explained. When Snake panics upon hearing the revelation, the doctor tries to calm him down before forcefully injecting an anesthetic to silence him.

7 years after the game's release, this scene suddenly triggered a [[meme]] in Japan in February 2022. It is mainly used to show that something has (or has not) happened in the last several years (e.g. "During the 4 years you've been in a coma, [[hunter x hunter|HUNTER×HUNTER]] still hasn’t started up again.")

h4. See also

* [[You're finally awake (meme)|]] - another meme with similar format
* [[Waking up from 2020 (meme)|]]

h4. External links

* "Know Your Meme: Nine Years in a Coma / Please Stay Calm and Listen":[https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/nine-years-in-a-coma-please-stay-calm-and-listen]
other_names: いいですか、落ち着いて聞いてください

title: kimi_no_na_wa.
body:
An animated movie written and directed by [[Shinkai Makoto]], released on August 26th 2016 in Japan.

The story involves a boy and a girl [spoiler]from different timelines[/spoiler] who communicate tenuously through dreamlike episodes of mutual possession. The story has been compared to others such as [[Kokoro Connect]] and keit-ai.

A critical success, its box office revenue exceeded 10 billion yen. It has become the first non-[[studio ghibli|Ghibli]] non-series based anime movie to do so. As of January 2017, it has become the highest-grossing anime film worldwide, surpassing Spirited Away, although it is still behind in Japan proper.

Genre: Romance, Supernatural, Drama

title: tsundere
body:
A character who alternates between a cold ([[tsuntsun]]) and loving ([[deredere]]) personality.

Tsundere characters are initially cold, temperamental, scolding, and sometimes even hostile, before gradually showing a warmer and friendlier side over time. Tsundere characters are generally more comedic than [[yandere]] characters, however this character type can be played more seriously as well.

This tag is for characters displaying this personality trait via their words or actions. A stereotypical example is offering a [[valentine|Valentine's Day]] [[gift]], but telling the recipient something akin to "I just had some extra, it's not like I like you or anything."

h4. Examples

* !post #537009
* !post #5709474

h4. Notable characters

* [[kugimiya rie|Kugimiya-type]]:
** [[Shana]] ([[Shakugan no Shana]])
** [[Louise Francoise Le Blanc de La Valliere]] ([[Zero no Tsukaima]]), with an [[sadism|S]]/[[masochism|M]] fetish.
** [[Sanzen'in Nagi]] ([[Hayate no Gotoku!]])
** [[Aisaka Taiga]] ([[Toradora!]])
** [[Minase Iori]] ([[Idolmaster]])
* [[Tohsaka Rin|Toosaka Rin]] ([[Fate/Stay Night]])
* [[Akebono (kancolle)|]], [[Kasumi (kancolle)|]], [[Murakumo (kancolle)|]] ([[Kantai Collection]])

title: amano_yukiteru
body:
The main character of [[Mirai Nikki]].

He is the First of the Diary Holders. His diary, the "No Difference" diary, keeps track of things that go on in his surroundings.

Yukiteru is a target of [[Gasai Yuno]]'s affection, a rather iconic [[yandere]] character. His actions are kept track of by Yuno's diary, even when he is not within range of her.

He is named after Jupiter of Roman mythology.

title: yandere-chan_(ramchi)
body:
An [[original]] character by [[ramchi]] based on the [[yandere]] character archetype.

She has [[large breasts]], [[red eyes]] and [[long_hair|long]] [[black hair]]. Usually wears a [[black serafuku]].

If you are looking for [[Yandere Simulator]] character, see [[Ayano Aishi]].

title: krul_tepes
body:
A character from [[Owari no Seraph]].

Krul Tepes is a third progenitor among the vampires and the vampire queen of Japan.

title: akashiya_moka
body:
Main female character of [[Rosario+Vampire]].

She is a [[vampire]], whose true powers are sealed by a [[rosary]] [[cross necklace]]. She has [[long hair|long]] [[pink hair]] with [[bangs]] & an [[ahoge]] and [[green eyes]]. She usually wears a [[school uniform]] that consists of a [[green jacket|green]] [[blazer]], [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]], a [[plaid skirt|plaid]] [[pleated skirt]], and [[black socks|black]] [[kneehighs]].

Her voice actor is [[Mizuki Nana]].

h4. See also

* [[Inner Moka]], her true form.

title: chiko_(puyopuyo)
body:
[[Puyopuyo]] character.

A timid tribal girl who only appears in the fourth Puyopuyo game.

Currently voiced by [[Hara Sayuri]] as of [[PuyoPuyo Quest]].

title: tsushima_yoshiko
body: One of the main characters from [[Love Live! Sunshine!!]]. A [[chuunibyou]] with a made-up persona as a fallen angel named "Yohane", Yoshiko insists on being called Yohane instead of her real name. She has [[red eyes]] and [[long hair|long]], [[blue hair]] and a [[single side bun]] on the right side of her head. She is a member of the Aqours sub-unit [[Guilty Kiss (love live!)|]], alongside [[Ohara Mari]] and [[Sakurauchi Riko]]. She is also the titular protagonist of the Sunshine!! fantasy spin-off [[Genjitsu no Yohane]]. Voiced by [[Kobayashi Aika]].

title: unlimited_fantasista
body: A costume/theme from [[Love Live! Sunshine!!]] voted by fans for [[Kurosawa Dia]], [[Tsushima Yoshiko]] and [[Takami Chika]] for their trio single [i]Party! Party! PaPaPaParty![/i] in a late October 2020 issue of Love Live! Days by [[Dengeki G's]] magazine to be part of Aqours' second duo and trio collection CD. The trio is also known as "GuuRinPa" (ぐ～りんぱ) from when their respective voice actors were hosting Uraraji radio broadcasts for the series. The name is a combination of one character each from the host actresses' last names: "Guu" (宮, "Guu") from Komiya (小宮, Komiya, after Dia's voice actor, [[Komiya Arisa]]), "Rin" (林, "Rin") from Kobayashi (小林, Kobayashi, after Yoshiko's voice actor, [[Kobayashi Aika]]), and "Ha" (波, "Ha") from Inami (伊波, Inami, after Chika's voice actor, [[Inami Anju]]), forming "GuuRinPa". h4. See Also * [[Inferno Phoenix]] ([[Kurosawa Dia]] and [[Kurosawa Ruby]]) – from first duo/trio collection CD * [[Unicorn Blizzard]] ([[Watanabe You]] and [[Tsushima Yoshiko]]) – from first duo/trio collection CD

title: batten_japari_dan
body: A team in [[Kemono Friends 3]] composed of [[Blackbuck_(kemono_friends)|]] (leader), [[Tasmanian Devil (kemono_friends)|]] and [[Australian Devil (kemono_friends)|]], voiced by the voice actor unit of Mirai Miki, Koizumi Moeka and Funato Yurie. Their theme song, Japari Rhapsody ("ジャパリ狂詩曲":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=79SmAwSE9Tw]), was revealed on July 27 2019.

title: captain_america:_civil_war
body: Captain America: Civil War is the sequel to [[Captain America: The Winter Soldier]] and the thirteenth movie in the [[Marvel Cinematic Universe]]. Both [[Black Panther (marvel)|]] and [[Spider-Man]] made their MCU debuts in this film before later appearing in their own standalone movies.

title: mclaren_p1
body:
Hybrid hypercar made by British supercar maker [[McLaren]]. It competed with the [[Ferrari LaFerrari]] and Porsche 918 Spyder, fellow hybrid hypercars of the mid-2010s. It spiritually succeeds the famous McLaren F1, although the two models are wholly unrelated other than their manufacturer.

[[Azur Lane]]'s [[St. Louis (Azur Lane)|]] is believed to be driving one in her [[St. Louis (Luxurious Wheels) (Azur Lane)|Luxurious Wheels]] skin as her car strongly resembles the real car.

title: yamaha_yzf-r1
body: A [[Yamaha]] sports [[motorcycle]]. Among the characters associated with it is [[Azur Lane]]'s [[Essex (Azur Lane)|Essex]], who has one that raced at the "2022 Suzuka 8 Hours":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ld0Eh6WPdRI] endurance motorcycle race at the [[Suzuka International Racing Course]] as Azur Lane partnered with Iwata Racing Family (IRF), Yamaha's employee-run team.

title: the_book_of_boba_fett
body:
A live action [[Star Wars]] series starring the titular [[Mandalorian]] bounty hunter who first appeared in [[Star Wars: The Empire Strikes Back|The Empire Strikes Back]] and set after the events of [[Star Wars: Return of the Jedi|Return of the Jedi]] when Boba suddenly takes over the Tatooine criminal empire that [[Jabba the Hutt]] once led. 

A spin-off of [[The Mandalorian]], where Boba appears a number of times in its second season, it is also created by Jon Favreau with executive producers including Favreau and Dave Filoni. It debuted on [[Disney]]'s Disney+ streaming service in December 2021.

title: inferno_phoenix
body:
A costume/theme from [[Love Live! Sunshine!!]] voted by fans for the Kurosawa sisters – [[Kurosawa Dia|Dia]] and [[Kurosawa Ruby|Ruby]] – for their duo single [i]Manatsu wa Dare no Mono?[/i] ("Midsummer Belongs To Whom?") in the June 2017 issue of Dengeki G's magazine to be part of Aqours' first duo and trio collection CD. A stage version was worn by their respective actresses, [[Komiya Arisa]] and [[Furihata Ai]], during the Aqours 2nd Love Live! HAPPY PARTY TRAIN TOUR. Inferno Phoenix was voted to be their primary theme ahead of Hurricane Blossom and Deep Forest Elf.

The costume is depicted differently depending on whether the magazine or stage version was the primary inspiration. At its most basic, it consists of red [[Arabian clothes]] with [[harem pants]] and a [[crop top]]. Common accessories include a [[feathers|feather]] [[hair ornament]] and various gold jewlery, including [[bracelet|bracelets]], [[armlet|armlets]], [[ring|rings]], [[necklace|necklaces]] or [[choker|chokers]].

h4. See also

* [[Unicorn Blizzard]] ([[Watanabe You]] and [[Tsushima Yoshiko]])
* [[Twilight Tiger]] ([[Takami Chika]] and [[Matsuura Kanan]])
* Hurricane Blossom ([[Sakurauchi Riko]], [[Kunikida Hanamaru]] and [[Ohara Mari]])

title: k/da_(league_of_legends)
body:
A virtual idol group styled after a [[K-pop]] [[idol]] group using characters from [[League of Legends]].

h4. Bio

K/DA exploded into the music scene with their hit song [i]POP/STARS[/i]. Fans of K/DA can't get enough of their unconventional flair, from the trademark tails (which fans suspect are real) to otherworldly decor in their studio. "Our songs are for you to remember - always be true to yourself," says lead singer Ahri. K/DA hopes to take their music around the world in a global tour.

h4. Members

* [[K/DA Ahri]] (lead vocalist)
* [[K/DA Evelynn]] (lead vocalist)
* [[K/DA Kai'Sa]] (lead dancer)
* [[K/DA Akali]] (rapper)

h4. See also

* [[DJ Sona]]
* [[Popstar Ahri]] (part of the same alternate universe – she is Ahri before joining K/DA)
* [[Pentakill (league of legends)|]]
* [[Seraphine (league of legends)|]]
* [[True Damage (league of legends)|]]

h4. External links

title: the_shawshank_redemption
body: Originally a Stephen King drama story in his 1982 novella [i]Rita Hayworth and Shawshank Redemption[/i] about Andy Dufresne and Ellis Boyd "Red" Redding (who is also the narrator), both inmates at Shawshank State Penitentiary in southern Maine for murder, though Andy is innocent. Shawshank is most well known for its 1994 film adaptation written and directed by Frank Darabont and starring Tim Robbins as Andy and [[Morgan Freeman]] as Red. The movie received seven [[Academy Award of Merit|Academy Award]] nominations and has been the top-rated film on the Internet Movie Database (IMDB) since 2008 when it passed [[The Godfather]]. In addition, the United States Library of Congress selected the film for preservation in the National Film Registry in 2015, finding it "culturally, historically, or aesthetically significant". Most works on Danbooru referencing Shawshank reference the movie poster where Andy stands in the rain after escaping Shawshank. h4. External links * "Wikipedia: The Shawshank Redemption":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Shawshank_Redemption] * "IMDB: The Shawshank Redemption":[https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0111161/]
other_names: ショーシャンクの空に

title: ii_fuufu_no_hi
body:
In Japan, November 22nd is sometimes called 良い夫婦の日 (Ii Fuufu no Hi, Good Couple Day).
Via number wordplay:
 11/22  ->  1 1 2 2  ->  i(chi) i(chi) fu(tatsu) fu(tatsu) -> ii fufu -> ii fuufu.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia entry":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Good_Spouses_Day

title: brown_long-eared_bat_(kemono_friends)
body: A [[Kemono Friends]] character. She is one of many "Friends" in Japari Park. She first appeared in the original 2015 mobile game, and later appeared in [[Kemono Friends Pavilion]] and [[Kemono Friends 3]] with an updated character design. In these games, she tends to be depicted as an energetic Friend with a good sense of responsibility; this is fairly different from other bat Friends, who tend to be easygoing and/or tricksters. This may be inspired by the brown long-eared bat's unique nature as a species, being a relatively slow-flying and largely diurnal bat. In September 2022, a [[virtual YouTuber]] based on Brown Long-Eared Bat debuted under the franchise's [[Kemono Friends V Project]] label as a member of its second wave, debuting alongside [[Siberian Chipmunk (Kemono Friends)|]] and [[Jungle Cat (Kemono Friends)|]]. KemoV's Brown Long-Eared Bat, commonly addressed by her nickname Usako, is a peppy and humorous girl who enjoys horror games and incorporates verbal tics associated with her [[Kemono Friends 3]] counterpart into her speech. She has a notably different design from her video game counterpart, having [[official alternate hair length|longer hair]] featuring a [[official alternate streak color|pink streak]] and a [[alternate breast size|dramatically larger chest]] as well as the [[official alternate costume|differing outfit]] that most other KemoV streamers have compared to their inspirations. h4. See also * [[Poporu (kemono friends)|]] h4. External links * "Usako's YouTube channel":https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCnyE-wD1pE2GZOxA6OHjW9g * "Usako's Twitter":https://twitter.com/Usako_KEMOV

title: violet_evergarden
body:

Considered a beautiful woman but lacks [[expressionless|expressions]], emotions, and remorse; but eventually meets different people and learns to become "human". Has [[prosthetic_arm|prosthetic]] [[mechanical arms]] after losing her arms in the war. 

She has [[medium hair|medium-length]] [[blonde hair]] with [[bangs]] and [[hair between eyes]], as well as [[blue eyes]]. Usually depicted with a [[braid]], [[red ribbon|red]] [[hair ribbon]], [[white dress]], [[blue jacket]], a [[necklace]] with a [[brooch]] in the middle, and a [[white skirt]].

title: ossan's_love
body:
A Japanese television drama produced by TV Asahi. The series follows Soichi Haruta, a romantically unsuccessful [[salaryman|office worker]] whose male boss and roommate confess their romantic feelings for him. Noted as one of the first Japanese television dramas in the [[yaoi|boys' love]] genre, Ossan's Love was initially released as a single-episode television special in 2016, which was adapted into a seven-episode television series in 2018. A feature film sequel to the television series, Ossan's Love: Love or Dead, was released in 2019; a second season of the television series titled Ossan's Love: In the Sky aired that same year.

A new season titled Ossan's Love Returns aired on January 5, 2024, with Tanaka, Yoshida, and Hayashi reprising their roles.

h4. External links
* "AsianWiki":https://asianwiki.com/Ossan%27s_Love
* Wikipedia: "Ossan's Love":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ossan%27s_Love

title: mohawk
body:
A type of hairstyle of which both side of the wearer's head is shaven, leaving a long strip of it down the middle of the scalp. Known and seen more when it is standing up due to gelling. Also known as a "Mohican," especially in Japan.

Mohawk also counts regardless if the hair is not standing straight up from the head.

The hairstyle is named after the Mohawk people, a Native American tribe, due to misrepresentation of their people in movies such as those from the 1930's.  It's closer to a hairstyle that was worn by the Native American Pawnee people.

h4. See also

* [[Tag Group:Hair Styles]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Mohawk hairstyle":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mohawk_hairstyle]

title: call_of_duty_4
body:
[b]Call of Duty 4: Modern Warfare[/b] is a critically acclaimed first-person shooter video game developed by [[Infinity Ward]] and published by [[Activision]]. It was released in 5 November 2007 for various gaming platforms, including [[PlayStation 3]], [[Xbox 360]], and PC.

This installment marked a significant departure from earlier games in the [[Call of Duty]] series by moving away from the [[World War II]] setting and delving into a modern-day, contemporary conflict. The game's storyline involves a fictional conflict in the Middle East and [[Russia]], where players take on the roles of different characters in the single-player campaign.

The game gained widespread praise for its engaging and cinematic single-player campaign, which presented a more realistic and gritty portrayal of modern warfare. It also introduced iconic characters like [[Captain Price]] and introduced the popular character-based storytelling approach to the franchise.

Moreover, the game's multiplayer component was a major success, introducing a leveling system, customizable loadouts, and various game modes that became highly influential in the FPS genre. It significantly contributed to the Call of Duty series' immense popularity and set a new standard for online multiplayer gaming.

h4. Characters

h6. Protagonists

* [[Captain Price]]
* [[Gaz (call of duty 4)|]]
* [[soap_(modern_warfare_2)|]]
* [[Kamarov_(modern_warfare)|]]

* [[Paul Jackson]]
* [[Ghost (modern warfare 2)|]]
* [[Special Air Service]]
* [[United States Marine Corps]]

h6. Antagonists

title: israel
body:
[b]Israel[/b] (Hebrew: יִשְׂרָאֵל/Yisra'el) is a country in the Middle East. The modern state proclaimed to be the successor of the various ancient [[Jewish]] states that once occupied Palestine prior the Arabic occupation.

As a modern country, it was founded in 1947 from a Palestinian territory previously colonized by the [[United Kingdom]] as a state for the Jewish people after the Holocaust during [[World War II]]. Conflict with the local Arabic populations has led to several wars with the neighboring Arabic countries, as a result, the country's status remains disputed to this day.

h4. See also

* [[Palestine]] - the disputed Palestinian territories primarily populated by Arabic people
* [[Star of David]]
* [[Israel-Hamas war]]

title: touhou_cannonball
body:
[b]Touhou Cannonball[/b] (東方キャノンボール) is a board-style mobile gacha [[Touhou]] doujin game developed by Quatro A and published by [[Aniplex]]. It was released in October 1, 2019 for Android and iOS platforms. Its service was terminated in October 14, 2020.

title: king_(snk)
body:
A character from [[SNK]]'s [[Ryuuko no Ken|Art of Fighting]] and [[The King of Fighters]] series. With [[short hair|short]], [[blonde hair]] and commonly dressed in a classy, masculine outfit, she is famed as a [[reverse trap]] of sorts. She is quite [[breasts|busty]] for a woman who dresses like a man. 

Trained in [[Muay Thai]], King developed a complex about her gender for being a female learning the style at the time, so she masqueraded as a man for a time. Initially hiding her gender in Art of Fighting 1 while serving as a bouncer working for [[Mr Big (SNK)|Mr. Big]], [[Ryou Sakazaki|Ryo Sakazaki]] (or [[Robert Garcia]]) forcefully exposed her gender by [[exploding clothes|blowing her shirt off]] and revealing her modesty underneath; despite this, King developed respect for Ryo for him not caring about her gender. After that point, she stopped making an effort to hide her gender and became a close friend of the Sakazaki family and the Kyokugen-ryuu Karate dojo. After Ryo and Robert helped her with hospital fees for her little brother Jan, King developed feelings for Ryo; she is commonly teased as a love interest of his, though she's too shy to admit it.

In the King of Fighters continuity, King is a founding member of the Women Fighters Team alongside [[Shiranui Mai|Mai Shiranui]] and [[Yuri Sakazaki]] - Ryo's little sister.

title: popolocrois_monogatari:_narcia_no_namida_to_yousei_no_fue

title: yuri_sakazaki
body:
A character from [[SNK|SNK's]] [[Ryuuko no Ken|Art of Fighting]] and [[The King of Fighters]] series. She wears a red [[headband]] and a training outfit - typically the upper half of a [[dougi]] - over a blue [[leotard]] and [[sports bra]]. She has [[brown hair]] most commonly done up as a [[braided ponytail]].

She is the second child and only daughter of [[karate|Kyokugen-ryuu Karate]] founder [[Takuma Sakazaki]]. She has an older brother named [[Ryou Sakazaki|Ryo]]. She is the love interest of fellow Kyokugen disciple and friend of the family [[Robert Garcia]].

She practices the Swallow discipline of Kyokugen-ryuu Karate, having learned the family style within a year (against her father's wishes, initially). She is also the first female to be able to perform the [[Haou Shoukou Ken|Haoh Shoko Ken]]. She is often described as a genius, able to learn moves very quickly. For this reason, Yuri has a habit of parodying moves from other characters, most infamously [[Ryu (Street Fighter)|Ryu]] and [[Akuma (Street Fighter)|Akuma]] from [[Street Fighter]] (a way for [[SNK]] to lightly poke fun back at [[Capcom]] after the latter made [[Hibiki Dan|Dan Hibiki]]).

She first appeared as a damsel in distress, kidnapped by [[Mr Big (SNK)|Mr. Big]] in Art of Fighting 1 and rescued by Ryo and Robert. She made her playable debut in Art of Fighting 2.

Her original fighting stage was a fitness gym, and her signature theme song is named "Diet". As of [[Fatal Fury: City of the Wolves]], which takes place long after the events of Art of Fighting, Yuri owns her own gym.

In the King of Fighters continuity, Yuri is a founding member of the Women Fighters Team alongside [[Shiranui Mai|Mai Shiranui]] and [[King (SNK)|]].

She has a voluntary verbal tic of adding "-cchi" to the end of her sentences, allegedly for the sole purpose of sounding cuter. For example, "余裕!"/"Yoyuu!" ("Easy!") becomes "余裕っち~!"/"Yoyuu-cchi~!" ("Easy peasy~!")

title: haou_shoukou_ken
body:
The [i]Haou Shoukou Ken[/i] (覇王翔吼拳), also spelt as [i]Haoh Shoko Ken[/i], is a super attack appeared in [[SNK]]'s [[Ryuuko no Ken|Art of Fighting]] and [[The King of Fighters]]. This powerful wide energy shot was invented by [[Takuma Sakazaki]] (though he names it Haou Shikou Ken), the founder of Kyokugen-ryuu Karate.

Note that a [[futaba channel]] [[meme]] called "(武器を持った奴が相手なら) 覇王翔吼拳を使わざるを得ない", lit. "I can't help but use Haou Shoukou Ken (to battle against armed enemies)" is not directly related to this tag. If you find images related to this [[meme]], use [[ryuuko no ken]], [[parody]], [[meme]] and [[motor vehicle]] (or [[motorcycle]], if necessary) tags. (e.g. post #995128) See also "KnowYourMeme":[http://knowyourmeme.com/memes/i-must-use-haoh-sho-ko-ken].

h4. Variants

* Haou Shikou Ken (覇王至高拳)
* Chou Haou Shikou Ken (超覇王至高拳)
* Raijin Haou Shoukou Ken (雷神 覇王翔吼拳)
* Tenshou Haou Shoukou Ken (天翔 覇王翔吼拳)

h4.Users

* [[Takuma Sakazaki]]
* [[Ryou Sakazaki|Ryo Sakazaki]]
* [[Mr. Karate|Mr. Karate]]
* [[Robert Garcia]]
* [[Yuri Sakazaki]]
* [[Marco Rodrigues]]

title: futaba_hotaru
body:
A character from the [[Fatal Fury]] series, debuting in [[Garou: Mark of The Wolves]] and returning in [[Fatal Fury: City of the Wolves]]. Hotaru is a young, soft-spoken girl trained in [[kung fu]], on the hunt for her missing brother who left home, whom she believes to be [[Gato (SNK)|Gato]].

Hotaru has [[blue eyes]] and [[blue hair]] with an [[ahoge]] typically done up as [[low twintails]]. She wears [[Chinese clothes|a kung fu outfit]] with [[puffy short sleeves]], [[puffy pants]], and [[flats]].

She's famous (or infamous) for one of her desperation moves, called [i]Tenshou Ranki[/i], that resembles the [[cowgirl position]] (complete with [[orgasm|orgasmic]] cry).

She has a pet [[ferret]] named [[Itokatsu (Garou)|]] she travels with.

title: dirtbike
body:
A dirtbike is a type of [[motorcycle]] designed for off-road use. Compared to common road-going motorcycles, dirtbikes are lighter and more flexible, typically having long suspension travel, and high ground clearance. The wheels have knobby tires which are suited for rough, unconventional terrain.

h4. See also

* [[List of ground vehicles]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Types of motorcycles":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Types_of_motorcycles#Off-road]

title: joe_higashi
body:
The tritagonist and co-protagonist of the [[Fatal Fury]] series alongside the Bogard brothers [[Terry Bogard|Terry]] and [[Andy Bogard|Andy]], and one of the main characters in [[The King of Fighters]] series.

Joe is a, if not the, world [[Muay Thai]] champion. He is famous for his Hurricane Upper move, which he throws an uppercut and summons a hurricane to attack enemies.

He normally wears red kickboxing trunks with a yellow trim and a red belt, complete with white tape on his wrist and brown ankle guards; but his outfit varies within each game. In the first Fatal Fury, he wears yellow trunks with a red trim and belt, both his wrists and ankles taped. In Real Bout Fatal Fury Special, he wears blue trunks with a red trim and belt, complete with tape on his wrist and ankle guards that match his trunks. He almost always wears a white [[headband]] with a red symbol on the front, typically a red dot.

As of [[Fatal Fury: City of the Wolves]], he has taken on a disciple, the young scientist [[Preecha (Fatal Fury)|Preecha]].

title: muay_thai
body:
[b]Muay Thai[/b], or Thai boxing, is a national sport of [[Thailand]] based on the Thai [[martial arts|martial art]] with the same name, a swift stand-up fighting style with various clinching techniques. Muay Thai later became a basis for [[Kickboxing]]. It is known as "the art of eight limbs," as the art places equal emphasis on fists, feet, elbows and knees. A practitioner of Muay Thai is called a [i]nak muay[/i].

Traditionally, Muay Thai practitioners can be distinguised in artworks by their [[mongkhon]] headband and/or pha jiad armbands, and were often depicted wearing [[hand wraps|hand]] and [[leg wrap]]s. Traditional Muay Thai practicioners prefer to fight bare-handed or with hand wrappings, though modern fighters also wears small [[boxing gloves]] or [[fingerless gloves]] instead.

While the derivative Kickboxing is very similar to Muay Thai, some of the distinctive moves that set them apart is the use of elbow and knee strike that were otherwise forbidden in Kickboxing.

title: famicom_tantei_club
body:
Famicom Tantei Club (lit. Famicom Detective Club) is a [[visual novel]] game trilogy produced by [[Nintendo]], the first two games originally released on the Famicom Disk System, with re-releases on the Super Famicom (and a third game on the Satellaview), Game Boy Advance, and eShops of the Wii, Wii U and 3DS. The first two games finally received their first Western release with the second remake on the Switch, and this release would inspire the creation of a whole new game in the series since 1997, released in 2024.

h4. List of titles 

* Famicom Tantei Club: Kieta Koukeisha (The Missing Heir)
* Famicom Tantei Club Part II: Ushiro ni Tatsu Shoujo (The Girl Who Stands Behind)
* BS Tantei Club: Yuki ni Kieta Kako (Lost Memories in the Snow)
* Famicom Tantei Club: Emio (The Smiling Man)

h4. Characters 

* [[Detective (famicom tantei club)|]] (1, 2) 
* [[Tachibana Ayumi]] (1, 2, 3) 
* [[Kojima Youko]] (2) 

h4. External links

* Wikipedia article: "Famicom Detective Club":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Famicom_Detective_Club

title: randoseru
body:
A style of [[backpack]] commonly used by elementary schoolchildren in Japan. Its name is derived from the Dutch "ransel". They're a firm leather pack with a single large flap that curves over the top.  The traditional colors are red for girls and black for boys, and are usually depicted this way.  Additional colors have been available since the 1960's, but culturally only took off after the 2000's. Black is still the preferred color for boys, but the preferred color for girls has shifted to lavender purple, peach pink, and light blue over red.

These bags are expensive, averaging around ¥60k, but are intended to last through the entirety of elementary school.

h4. Examples

* !post #7551929
* !post #6214860
